intro: Asteropterus callicornia, commonly known as the horned fern, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Davalliaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, fiddlehead-like fronds that unfurl as they grow. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its native habitat. Its leaves are often leathery and have a unique, spiky appearance. Asteropterus callicornia thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests.
